text:
Hello! My marketing agency, HIVE Strategy is looking for a UX Consultant to help us with our website projects. Our clients are growing in complexity and we believe adding a UX person to the beginning of our website projects will greatly enhance the user experience for our clients and greatly benefit the overall end result of our websites.

We are looking for someone to assist with all or some of the following:
1. User Research: Conducting user research to understand the target audience, their goals, behaviors, and preferences. This may involve interviews, surveys, user testing, and other methods to gather insights.

2. Requirements Gathering: Collaborating with stakeholders, such as clients, designers, and developers, to understand project requirements, business goals, and constraints. The consultant ensures that user needs are effectively communicated and incorporated into the website design.

3. User Journey Mapping: Creating user journey maps to visualize the end-to-end experience of users interacting with the website. This helps identify pain points, areas of improvement, and opportunities for enhancing the user experience.

4. Information Architecture: Defining the website's information architecture, including site structure, navigation menus, and content organization. The UX consultant ensures that the website's content is logically structured and easy to navigate.

5. Wireframing and Prototyping: Developing low-fidelity wireframes or interactive prototypes to visualize the website's layout, page structure, and user interactions. These prototypes allow stakeholders to review and provide feedback on the proposed design before development.

6. Usability Testing: Planning and conducting usability testing sessions to evaluate the website's usability and identify any usability issues or areas for improvement. The consultant may observe users interacting with the website and gather feedback to make informed design decisions.

7. Visual Design Guidance: Collaborating with visual designers to provide guidance on visual elements such as color schemes, typography, and overall aesthetics. The UX consultant ensures that the visual design aligns with the website's usability and user experience goals.

8. Accessibility Considerations: Ensuring that the website meets accessibility standards and guidelines to accommodate users with disabilities. The consultant provides recommendations and conducts audits to improve accessibility and inclusive design.

9. Iterative Design Process: Facilitating an iterative design process, where feedback and insights from user research, testing, and stakeholder input are used to refine the website design. The consultant helps prioritize and implement design improvements based on user needs and project goals.

10.Collaboration and Communication: Working closely with the project team, including designers, developers, content creators, and stakeholders, to ensure effective collaboration and communication throughout the project. The consultant acts as an advocate for the user, helping align all parties towards creating an exceptional user experience.

Would love to chat!
